bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Elizabeth D. Guthrie (1910-2005) served as the director of the VPI Glee Club from at least 1940 to 1943 (her records and account end suddenly in 1943, the time in which the VPI cadets left to serve in WWII). According to Guthrie's account, after the previous VPI glee club had disbanded, two cadets approached Guthrie in the fall of 1940 to inquire whether she might be interested in directing a new Glee Club. The club met in War Memorial Hall, and Guthrie volunteered as director for the first year, since the club had no funds.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of material relating to the V.P.I. Glee Club from the years 1940-1946. The collection contains administrative files, the "Blackout" program script, sheet music, including the original version of "Moonlight and VPI," and group photographs. The administrative files contain annual reports, concert programs, and correspondence to and from Elizabeth D. Guthrie, Glee Club Director. The administrative files also include a brief history of VPI's Glee Club, and Guthrie's role within it. Some of the material contains handwritten explanatory notes added by Elizabeth D. Guthrie.
